dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AARON GREENBERG (early 20s) is walking across the stage getting his diploma. He could not be more excited. If you could bottle enthusiasm, generosity of spirit and a touch naivety, you would get this young gentleman. He gets his diploma, hugs the president of the university hard, and w to the crowd who cheer him on. He throws kisses towards someone in particular. ANGLE ON HIS PRETTY, ARTSY GIRLFRIEND, DAPHNE BINKS (earl 20s), also in a cap and gown, and her parents, MR. AND MR BINKS. She smiles, waves and throws kisses back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the VOICE of Aldous Snow (30s), English rock star drugged out of his mind, in his empty apartment. Floor to ceiling windows look out on beautiful views of the Thames the London cityscape. We PAN PAST a leather couch, a pile trash, an Andy Warhol on the floor, various drug paraphernalia.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You enjoying this?

dialogues.speaker: PROSTITUTE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You know I am, love. REVEAL Aldous on the floor kissing a PROSTITUTE-LIKE WOMA

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: How about this? Suddenly Aldous is peeing on the Prostitute.

dialogues.speaker: PROSTITUTE
dialogues.text: I like that alright... what the bloody shit?

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: How about this? Aldous THROWS UP on the prostitute and COLLAPSES.

dialogues.speaker: PROSTITUTE
dialogues.text: You piece of shit!

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: (with an odd flourish) You are welcome, milady! He lights a cigarette, grabs the remote and FLIPS ON THE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: We should have killed all you Irish when we had the chance. The Irish Guy GRABS Aldous. Aldous licks the Irish guy’s face. The Irish Guy drops him, disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Make love to me my Irish lass! EXT. DOWNTOWN LOS ANGELES ARTISTS’ LOFT BUILDING - DAY Aaron and Daphne are in a rather grungy area of downtown They walk through a protective cage into a newly renovate building that is advertising “Real Artists’ Lofts.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron and Daphne walk with a REALTOR around the loft spac There’s a studio with a potter's wheel. Daphne’s clearly heaven.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: We will rent it.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Are you sure you can afford it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Definitely! Daphne jumps up and down, hugs Aaron and heads off to exp the loft. Aaron looks very, very nervous. INT. ALDOUS SNOWS’S LIVING ROOM - DAY Aldous and a COURTNEY LOVE-ESQUE girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: I’M NOT THE ONE WHO FUCKED YOU OVER!!! YOU’RE THE ONE WHO FUCKED

dialogues.speaker: FUCKING BLOODY HELL BITCH
dialogues.text: Aldous grabs her. She punches him in the face. He punches her in the chest, and then they get into a crazy fist fig like a couple burly man. In a crazy almost karate like mo she kicks his feet out from under him. He CRASHES through glass coffee table. She leaves the room. EXT. ALDOUS’S ULTRA LUXURY APARTMENT BUILDING - DAY His door flies open. It’s the middle of the day in the center of London. It’s very, very busy. She’s walking across the lawn.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: DON'T GO!!! I LOVE YOU!!! DON’T

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: A YOUNG TWEEN GIRL and her FRIEND see Aldous.

dialogues.speaker: TWEEN GIRL
dialogues.text: It’s Aldous Snow! They start taking photos with their camera phones. Aldous flips them off.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: Fuck off you cunts!  He heads back into his house.

dialogues.speaker: TWEEN GIRL
dialogues.text: Aldous Snow just called us cunts!

dialogues.speaker: SECOND TWEEN GIRL
dialogues.text: That was brilliant! EXT. AARON AND DAPHNE’S LOFT APARTMENT Daphne's parents, MR. AND MRS. BINKS are outside the protective cage. They hit the buzzer. A large group of homeless people walk by.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BINKS
dialogues.text: Where the hell are we, Kabul? They hit the buzzer again.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mom, dad, come on up! INT. AARON AND DAPHNE’S LOFT APARTMENT - NIGHT Aaron serves dinner to Daphne and DAPHNE’S PARENTS.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: More Italian tofu and chianti pasta?

dialogues.speaker: MR. BINKS/MRS. BINKS
dialogues.text: No. Thank you./Couldn’t possibly. Aaron sits down.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BINKS
dialogues.text: So, Aaron, when does your job at Pinnacle start?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Monday, actually.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BINKS
dialogues.text: Well, that is exciting.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Thanks, Mrs. Binks. It is thrilling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don’t get it. You got a college degree. Why would you work as someone’s secretary?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Intern, not a secretary.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BINKS
dialogues.text: Intern? Like Monica Lewinsky? You gonna be taking out any dry cleaning? I’m just kidding.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: If you want to get into the music biz you start as an intern.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BINKS
dialogues.text: Whatever. So how’s your arts and crafts going?

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: You don’t have to be so dismissive of it, dad.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: You should see the sculptures she’s doing. She’s got some great projects up her sleeve. We see that Daphne’s touched by Aaron standing up for her

dialogues.speaker: MR. BINKS
dialogues.text: I’m just worried that a creative and an intern living together -- who’s the support beam? Judging by this neighborhood you’re barely holding on as is.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: First of all, this place is not cheap. Downtown’s coming back.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BINKS
dialogues.text: From what? Armageddon?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I don’t make much but I make enough for the two of us. a *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens when you lose your job because the music industry is downsizing because no one buys records anymore?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I guess I’1l just have to resort to my previous work -- male escort. Daphne snickers. Her parents do not.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Mom, you want to take a tour of the building? INT. AARON AND DAPHNE’S LOFT APARTMENT Aaron's awkwardly sitting in silence with Daphne’s dad in living room.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: How’s the corporate law these days?

dialogues.speaker: MR. BINKS
dialogues.text: It’s a job. Aaron, I just wanted to say something to you. I can see how much you care for my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I do, sir. Very much. Honestly, and I know, I’m young, but I hope to one day marry her.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BINKS
dialogues.text: Don’t call me sir.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I called you sir?

dialogues.speaker: MR. BINKS
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I didn’t even notice.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BINKS
dialogues.text: Well, you did.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I'm... sorry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to tell you that I think you two are making a terrible mistake moving in together.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: What? Why?

dialogues.speaker: MR. BINKS
dialogues.text: You two are not ready at all.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Yeah we are.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BINKS
dialogues.text: No you aren’t.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I believe we are.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BINKS
dialogues.text: I believe you aren't.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I love her.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BINKS
dialogues.text: No you don’t.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Yes I do.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BINKS
dialogues.text: No you don’t.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I do. I do love her too.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BINKS
dialogues.text: You just don’t.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Yes, I do. We’re perfect for each other. I mean, we’ve never even had a fight. That’s how awesome we are together. I know my feelings and they are of love.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BINKS
dialogues.text: You don’t and they aren’t. You’re not right for her. She’s a flighty girl. She needs someone more grounded. + eH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's an amazing sculptor. It just takes a while to break into the art world. (clearly repeated froma speech Daphne has said) You have to apprentice first and even just to get the apprenticeship can take years but art isn’t about money, it’s about --

dialogues.speaker: MR. BINKS
dialogues.text: I’m not going to debate my daughter’s future with you. She’s a cute girl who needs to land a rich husband before she pops out a few grand kids and ends up teaching art in an elementary school.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I think she’s talented.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BINKS
dialogues.text: The world has too much talent and not enough customers. Here’s the deal: quit playing house like a little girl. You’re in the music biz. Go out, party like a rock star, experiment with drugs, go apeshit crazy so you don’t end up doing it later in life. Move in with a couple best male friends and live it up. Now’s the time.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I already live with my best friend. Daphne's my best friend.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BINKS
dialogues.text: No, she isn’t. Daphne and her mom return to the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BINKS
dialogues.text: Well that was fun. I love your neighborhood. It’s so... urban. We should go before it gets any darker. INT. AARON AND DAPHNE’S LOFT APARTMENT Aaron and Daphne are cleaning up the meal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if my dad’s right? What if I have no talent?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: First of all, he said you had talent. He just said there’s not enough customers. Which there are, by the way. Forget I mentioned it.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Maybe this is all just shit shit shit and shit. I just want to break it all and start over again.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? This is so super pretty. REVEAL they’re discussing a sculpture of a bloody, scream woman holding a bloody, screaming baby. It’s more terrify than pretty. She definitely has talent, a dark weird tale

dialogues.speaker: AARON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you use glaze?

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Yeah. He’s right. My career’s going nowhere. I suck.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Let’s make a game plan. Rent a gallery downtown. Advertise the show in LA Weekly. Maybe do some guerrilla marketing stuff. We’ll just get this done. Aaron's relentless positivity is starting to grate.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: The point isn’t the show, Aaron. It’s not that easy. Trying to do something creative is just different than what you do. It’s not a linear process. No offense. (then) I’m sorry. I know I’m being difficult and a bitch about all this stuff.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: You're not being a bitch.  10.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: I was being a bitch. You can be mad at me.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I’m not mad at you.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: I love that you’re nice. You’re the first nice guy I’ve ever dated and I love that about you. But when I’m being a bitch and you don’t say I’m being a bitch you’re keeping a part of yourself closed off from me. Feel free to be honest and tell me when you're annoyed at me.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I’m being totally honest. That's what I love about us. I can always be honest. You couldn’t ever annoy me. You’re too perfect. Daphne smiles at this.

dialogues.speaker: AARON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And as for getting your career off the ground, just make a list of what needs doing. That’s how I get stuff done. Daphne takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Cool. I’ll try that. I/’11 just make a list. Daphne leaves the room. Aaron smiles after her. INT. AARON AND DAPHNE’S LOFT APARTMENT - MORNING Aaron and Daphne are asleep. The radio alarm goes off. It six am. Aaron sits up and smiles. MUSIC CUE: Talking Heads “Love - Building on Fire.”

dialogues.speaker: AARON GETTING READY TO GO TO WORK
dialogues.text: -- Aaron's singing to Talking Heads in the shower. -- Aaron flips on the coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Daphne lays out Aaron’s clothes on the bed. Aaron puts his clothes and looks at them in the mirror. She gives hi thumbs up. -- Aaron peruses the LA Times, Variety, Billboard, and several other music magazines. -- Aaron drives to work, still singing to Talking Heads. MONTAGE ENDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: AARON

dialogues.text: Then you have to park on the street. MUSIC CUE: Talking Heads again -- Aaron looks for parking -- Tries to park in a tiny space. -- Aaron reads the parking signs and realizes he has to m INT. PINNACLE ENTERTAINMENT GARAGE — DAY Aaron pulls back in, big smile on his face.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Me again. Couldn’t find parking.

dialogues.speaker: VALET
dialogues.text: Then it’s a $1.50 every twenty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron walks into Pinnacle. Marble, glass, brightly lit atrium. It’s gorgeous. A row of clocks LOS ANGELES NEW YO LONDON MOSCOW TOKYO line the wall.  12.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: May I help you?

dialogues.speaker: AARON

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I love Amadeus. So passionate.

dialogues.speaker: CLASSICAL MUSIC VP
dialogues.text: Box those LPs. He points to a disorderly pile of LPs and leaves the room CUT TO ONE HOUR LATER. Aaron is finished boxing them. He looks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e HF

Andrea smiles, despite herself as Aaron heads STRAIGHT into Sergio’s off INT. SERGIO ROMA’S OFFICE - DAY Aaron walks in. SERGIO ROMA, the charismatic terrifying president of Pinnacle, is on the phone. He never yells. Yelling is beneath him.

dialogues.speaker: SERGIO
dialogues.text: I am not the who gets fucked. I am the one who does the fucking. You see what I’m saying? Ciao. He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: SERGIO, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: AARON

dialogues.speaker: AARON, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: AARON, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: SERGIO, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST

dialogues.speaker: SERGIO
dialogues.text: Alright, baby. Go now, go. She leaves.

dialogues.speaker: SERGIO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take Aaron. I always like to chat with my new guys before they start up here. Who’s your idol? Like, who do you hope to be in thirty years.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: David Geffen. He’s the king. I hope to be him in every way, except, not, you know...

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Lifestyle wise.

dialogues.speaker: AARON

dialogues.speaker: SERGIO
dialogues.text: I am.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: That’s crazy. I’m actually gay as well.

dialogues.speaker: SERGIO
dialogues.text: You just said you weren’t.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I know, I just didn’t know how you’d respond or whatever. It’s so nice to be working for a fellow gay guy. Are you out because I’ve read almost everything about you --

dialogues.speaker: SERGIO
dialogues.text: Don’t you worry about that. How long have you known you were gay?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I realized when I was ten or thirteen. I would play sports with the guys and I realized I didn’t just want to play sports with them. I wanted to kiss them on the mouth.

dialogues.speaker: SERGIO
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. I remember that. So are you in a relationship now?

dialogues.text: Not anyone specifically. I’11 make out with four strangers in a night. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: AARON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Like last night I was at this gay bar and I had sex with this guy who looked exactly like Ryan Gosling, probably was him if you know what I mean, and, well, I’1l probably never see him again. How about you? What bars do you frequent?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Honestly, last night, I think I found the dude I’m going to spend the rest of my life with. Looks exactly like Ryan Seacrest but like more toned.

dialogues.speaker: SERGIO
dialogues.text: Does it look like I give a fuck?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Honestly no. (then) Look, Columbia Vancouver was chump change. I’ve come to play in the big leagues. I’ve got connects at the Whiskey Lounge, Spaceland, the Smell, et cetera. I will do anything to prove my worth to you. Anything, Serge.

dialogues.text: Suzette!

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: But you just told me you loved me.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE Q
dialogues.text: That was then, this is now.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: That was like twenty minutes ago.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE Q
dialogues.text: My emotions can’t be controlled. You know that. Suzette scoops Naples out of the pool. Naples howls.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE Q, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now look what you’ve done. You’ve gotten Naples all pissed. Suzette!

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: Don’t take him away, lady! Don’t take my son away!

dialogues.speaker: NAPLES
dialogues.text: I don’t want to go!

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE Q
dialogues.text: Stop with the melodrama. You've seen him like three times in the last five years.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: That’s gonna change right now! I love him! A son should be raised by his father!

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE Q
dialogues.text: Well in that case he should be raised by Hugh Grant.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: What? No. Me. He’s half me.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE Q
dialogues.text: No he’s not. He’s half me, he’s half Hugh Grant. That’s the truth. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE Q, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I shoulda told you six years ago but if I had you woulda stopped sending me child support payments. That’s not right which is why I’m going to pay you back. In fact I‘ll write the check right now.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: I don’t care if he’s not my son! I still love him! I LOVE YOU, KID!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aldous walks down Mulholland, crying hysterically. CHYRON: FOUR HOURS UNTIL THE GREEK.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: I have no one! NO ONE!!! He looks out over Los Angeles. He collapses. He looks dow at his phone. He scrolls through the photos on his phone. It’s just naked trampy girl after naked trampy girl (with Patrick Dempsey thrown in). He gets to the photo of Aaron from the night in Vegas when he was freaking out. INT. AARON AND DAPHNE’S APARTMENT Aaron and Daphne are eating dinner. Aaron is holding Daphne’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: You're really going to hold my hand all the way through dinner?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I didn’t even notice. The doorbell rings. Aaron goes to the door and opens it, revealing Aldous.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: So this is where you live?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? You're supposed to be at the Greek.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: I need you with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you need me I can totally go to wherever you are. Daphne shows up behind Aaron.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: My gosh, Aldous Snow!

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: Are you Daphne? You are even more lovely in person. Daphne holds out her hand. Aldous kisses it. INT. AARON AND DAPHNE’S APARTMENT - MOMENTS LATER Aaron, Daphne and Aldous are sitting in the living room. They're drinking wine. Aldous stares at the sculpture fro the beginning that Aaron described as “pretty.”

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: I love this piece.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: But I also hate it. It looks the way my insides feel, all fucked up and tossed around. It’s like nausea in three dimensions.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I don’t know about --

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: That is a relief. That’s exactly what I trying to create.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: You want me to drive you to some LA hot spots? I can take you to the Standard, the Chateau --

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: I want nothing more than to be right here in your apartment. Aaron downs his glass of wine.  99.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (looking at a photo) Where’s this?

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Buenos Aires. That was our first transatlantic trip together.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: The presidential suite at the Buenos Aires Ritz is the nicest hotel room I’ve ever been to.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Yeah, we were staying in a hostel.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: Well, next time check it out. Also, Argentinean prostitutes are out of this world. Aaron's about to cover but Daphne giggles in an oddly flirtatious way. QUICK CUTS OF THEM DRINKING AND LAUGHING TOGETHER while A looks more and more uncomfortable. Aldous plays and sings John Mayer’s “Daughters” on a guit while Daphne and Aaron watch, holding hands.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I am astonished and fascinated at your longevity as a couple.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: It’s only been three years.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: I getcha, man. It’s my longest relationship by far. Sometimes, it’s like, wow.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: What do you do when you’re ina relationship for that long. Like, how do you keep it lively?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: It’s easy because we love each other.  100.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: Aren’t you worried that you’re missing out?

dialogues.speaker: AARON/DAPHNE
dialogues.text: On what?/Sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: (ignoring Daphne) On what?

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: Like if you could have done one sexual activity before you died what would have been?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: (joking) What, like a threesome?

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: Sure like that.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I guess a threesome.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: Threesome. Do you have any fantasies like that?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I was just joking.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: I’d love to try a threesome. You know, before I die.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: Well that is something that is possible right now. It’s not like wanting to fly or shoot lasers out of your eyes. A threesome is something that we can accomplish right here right now.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: That would be hilarious, us having a threesome.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: We should do it.  101.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: If you’d like, but I certainly don’t want to apply any pressure. I have had my share of threesomes.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: C'mon, let’s do a threesome. Wouldn’t that be fun?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I was speaking completely theoretically. I’m not actually sure whether we should really be having a threesome in reality.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: You just said it’s something that you'd like to try.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Well, I mean, it is.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: So why not try it? If we don’t like it we don’t have to do it again.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: I got this mate who I had a threesome with and he didn’t like it and then he never had one again. Daphne looks at Aaron like “see?”

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: I mean, unless you’re scared.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I’m not scared. I was just worried that you might be scared. I didn’t want to press you into anything.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: You aren’t.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: If you’re not scared.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: I’m not scared.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Then neither am I.  102.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: (clapping his hands together) Perfect! Let me get my whip. (off their looks) Just joking. Don’t take life so seriously! Aldous starts very casually taking his clothes off.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, what’re you waiting for? Daphne and Aaron start taking their clothes off too. It’s very awkward and proforma. INT. AARON AND DAPHNE’S BEDROOM - LATER Aldous, Aaron and Daphne are awkwardly sitting on the bed

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: So... how do we start this? Because if we can’t, we don’t need to -- Aldous starts making out with Daphne. INT. AARON AND DAPHNE’S BEDROOM PAN FROM Aldous having crazy amazing sex with Daphne to A sitting on the bed looking not really all that happy.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: So... I’m... gonna get some water. (then) Do you guys need anything?

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: I’d love some. Aaron gets off the bed and goes into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron fills up a glass with water. Then a second glass wi water. He then looks at himself holding two glasses of water. He is literally serving water to his girlfriend an the man who is fucking her.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: I am going to ejaculate!  103.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: This is bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I am ejaculating! Ahhhhhh! INT. AARON AND DAPHNE’S APARTMENT Aaron rushes back into the bathroom. Aldous is somehow having sex with Daphne’s face. Or at least that’s what we have to assume. All the drive drops out of Aaron.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Hey, guys. Where do you want me to put your water?

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: C’mon, baby, get involved. Aaron awkwardly tries to get into the action.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: Oh boy! Oh boy! Oh boy! I am going to ejaculate again! Aldous pulls out and ejaculates. We don’t see it. We just see Aaron’s face change.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: What’s the problem?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: You got it on me, man! Aaron is frozen in terror/disgust.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: I didn’t mean to. That was an unintentional sperming.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Hey, you gotta expect that kind of thing is going to happen in this sort of situation.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: I am starving. I understand there’s a delicious diner around the corner. You interested, mate?  104.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Nahhh, I’m good, mate. I think I'd rather stay here then watch you eat pancakes after you’ve had sex with every part of my girlfriend and then jizzed on my leg now GET THE

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Hey, Aaron, let’s talk about this!

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I don’t want to talk about this while he’s here! And once he’s not here this is nothing we can talk about! This cannot be solved through discussion! This is you cheating, right in front of me!

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: I don’t think it’s cheating when it’s a consensual threesome.

dialogues.text: I thought you were cool with the whole threesome thing.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: That wasn’t a threesome! That was a twosome with me watching!

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: You could have jumped in. We weren’t being exclusionary. That’s against the rules.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: This isn’t about rules or not rules! This is about you fucking her right in front of me! And why are you in this conversation? Why are you even here? Aldous leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Aaron, I didn’t mean for this happen.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: You were the one who said you'd be into a threesome!  105.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: After you said it! If you didn’t want to, why weren’t you honest about that? I would’ve said no if you didn’t want to do it.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I shouldn’t have to say anything to get you to not have sex with another man!

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: Sexual mores are just a thing of the past century. We are all living in a false construct.

dialogues.speaker: GET OUT
dialogues.text: Aldous leaves again.

dialogues.speaker: AARON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How could this happen? Our life was just going along at a great, awesome clip. Why?

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Daphne and Aaron both start to tear up.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I want you to hug me even though you were having sex with a different guy like two minutes ago. What is wrong with me?

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: I want to hug you too. It’s OK. Daphne and Aaron hug.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Why am I letting you do this? Get away from me, you... you... whore. Neither Aaron nor Daphne can believe he just called her a whore.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: I’m gonna go.  106. Daphne goes. He notices that Aldous’s black manpurse is still in the apartment. He picks it up and it spills open revealing a box of needles. Aldous walks in.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: I forgot my satchel.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: You're jealous of my piddly life so you destroy it. Aaron takes a needle out of the box and TOSSES IT at Aldo

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: Woh. Alright, mate. Let’s just hand them over.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Congrats. Destruction complete. Aaron throws a second needle like a dart and NAILS Aldous the arm.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: Ow! Aaron throws a third and fourth and fifth. They land in Aldous’s leg, chest and right below his eye.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell, man? Aldous pulls the needle out of his face and tosses it bac sticking Aaron in the arm.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Hey, watch it!

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: You've been throwing them.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Yeah, but that one was in you. Now I’ve got whatever blood diseases you've got. Aldous takes another and throws it at Aaron. Suddenly the are in a FULL SCALE NEEDLE FIGHT, tossing needles back an forth with frighteningly fast abandon.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: Draw! Draw!  107. They stop. Aldous throws another needle at Aaron. The needle fight starts again. While throwing needles, they s the following things --

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t you get it! I’m done! The only person that ever loved me hates me! I’m done making music! I’m done! I might as well go kill myself!

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Fine! Go ahead, you big baby! Kill yourself! You just fucked my girlfriend and then she dumped me! I don’t give a shit what you do! And make sure to swallow all the pills! If you swallow only half you just get sleepy! Better yet, shoot yourself, but make sure to do it in the head! That way you’ll have the best shot at actually succeeding in killing yourself!

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: I'm sorry if I’ve been a disappointment. I hope to one day make it up to you.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Get out! Aldous leaves. Aaron collapses on the couch. INT. AARON AND DAPHNE’S APARTMENT - EVENING

dialogues.speaker: CHYRON
dialogues.text: Aaron watches television, depressed. The phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Hey, Aaron, it’s Daphne. We should probably talk about what just happened. I’m at my parent’s house. Please call. I love you. Like a lot. I’m sorry. She starts to cry and hangs up. The phone rings again. He lets it go to answering machine.

dialogues.speaker: SERGIO
dialogues.text: Where the fuck are you guys? He was supposed to be here --  108. Aaron pulls the phone cord from the wall and throws it against the wall. A piece of the phone hits Aaron in the head. Aaron goes into the bathroom. On the mirror there’s note. He opens the envelope. The note reads:

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Dear Aaron. This is my last will and testament. Since I have no kids or wife or really anything I’m leaving my estate to you. If you want to see me off, I’1l be jumping from the Hollywood sign at nine, depending on traffic. I want my body to be cryogenically frozen, to be unfrozen when there’s a chemical cure for addiction or heroin becomes legal, whichever comes first. Yours, Aldous. P.S. I’m sorry for making love to your girlfriend. That was done out of self-anger. P.P.S. I do not know if this last will and testament will hold up in a court of law. I apologize if it doesn’t. In fact, the more I think about it the more unlikely it seems that it will. Sorry, mate. Aaron takes a beat.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Fuck him. Aaron throws out the note. He looks at a clock on the wal It’s 7:00PM.

dialogues.speaker: AARON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, fuck him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron takes a shower. The radio’s on.

dialogues.speaker: NPR ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: It’s 8:00PM and now for your traffic update.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Fuck him.  109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron's at Denny’s. He orders a coffee. He looks at his watch. It’s 8:30PM.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Fuck him. The waitress comes over.

dialogues.speaker: AARON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (chipper to the waitress) Are the corn pancakes good?

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: If you like corn. MOMENTS LATER Aaron waits for his food. He checks his wat It’s now 8:35.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Fuck him. The Waitress returns with the corn pancakes, eggs and bac

dialogues.speaker: AARON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thank you so much. Aaron looks at his watch. It’s now 8:36.

dialogues.speaker: AARON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuck him. MOMENTS LATER: Aaron's reading LA Weekly. He looks at his watch. It’s now 8:37.

dialogues.speaker: AARON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuck him. His cell rings. Aaron jumps. He looks and sees that it sa “Daphne.” He hits it to voicemail. He reads the paper and sees an ad for Aldous Snow at the Greek. He looks at his watch again. It’s still 8:37.

dialogues.speaker: AARON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuck him. A BUS BOY clearing a nearby table looks at Aaron. Aaron looks at his watch again. He stares as it changes from 8: to 8:38.  110. INT. AARON’S CAR Aaron is driving really fast.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Fuck him fuck him fuck him fuck him fuck him fuck him -- His cell rings. It’s Sergio. He hits it to voicemail. MOMENT WHERE Aaron is pulled to the side of the road, ver laboriously putting in “Hollywood Sign” in his point of interest in his GPS device.

dialogues.speaker: AARON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuck him fuck him fuck him... Hollywood Tire... Hollywood Dog Track... Hollywood Sheepskin... what the fuck? Why doesn’t it just have the Hollywood sign?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron pulls up alongside a TOUR BUS.

dialogues.speaker: TOUR BUS DRIVER
dialogues.text: Who here’s a fan of the Governator? (the tourists clap) Hasta la vista, State House! The people on the tour bus laugh.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Excuse me, where’s the Hollywood sign?

dialogues.speaker: TOUR BUS DRIVER
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, you'll have to pay for the tour to learn that information -

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I said where’s the fucking Hollywood sign? I will ram my car into your bus if you don’t tell me right the fuck now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron pulls up in his car. The clock on his car reads 8:57PM.  111.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Fuck him fuck him fuck him fuck him fuck him fuck him! Aaron jumps out of his car.

dialogues.speaker: AARON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuck him fuck him fuck him fuck him fuck him fuck him fuck him -- Aaron scrambles down the desert hill. He reaches a barbed wire fence and tries to climb over it, getting caught in barbed wire. He jumps down from the fence.

dialogues.speaker: AARON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (while looking for another opening) Fuck him fuck him fuck him fuck him Aaron's phone rings. It’s Sergio. He hits send to voicemail. Aaron sees an opening in the fence. Someone ha clearly cut an opening out. He crawls through the hole. EXT. HOLLYWOOD SIGN —- CONTINUOUS Aaron is now down at the Hollywood sign. He sees Aldous standing on top of the “H.”

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Hey asshole, don’t jump! Aaron crawls down to the sign.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: Why not? I’ve got nothing. I'ma drug addicted nothing. My friends are all addicts or yes men. I can’t even write music anymore. I’m not even sure if I even ever could. Most of my songs are just ripoffs of the Beatles and the Clash. I’m the nugget of shit that hangs off the asshair of humanity.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: No you aren’t. You can have sex with whoever you want whenever you want.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: Sex isn’t love. Sex has gotten boring. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All I live for is getting high. If I don’t die from this I'll die from an overdose. At least if I jump I’m making the choice, not the drink and the drugs.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Jumping’s for pussies. Jumping is what you do out of fear. You really going to be a pussy? You really going to throw away the one thing God has given us, life, for nothing?

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: I didn’t know you were religious.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I didn’t know it either until right now but I think I am and I think what you’re doing is downright immoral. In my one week with you I’ve seen more of the world then I have in my entire twenty three years. Don’t throw it all away man. Life is precious. Don’t just toss it away like a used needle. Instead, take that needle and shoot up life instead.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: Why’re you doing this? Do you love me?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: No, I don’t love you. I kind of hate you.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: Tell me you love me.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I love you in the way one is required to love all humanity.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: Tell me that you love me and me specifically, not just the general concept of humanity. Beat. Aldous moves to the edge of the “H.”  113.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I love you... and you specifically not just the general concept of humanity. I love you, Aldous Snow. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: I love you too, Aaron Greenberg. I love you too. Aldous, taking an intentional Christ like pose, JUMPS off “H” and hits the dusty desert below with a resounding and sickening thud. He rolls down the hill.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Fuck you! Aaron SCRAMBLES down the hill after Aldous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aldous rolls down the hill, crashing through a fence and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- into a Hills house backyard, splashing right into a ho tub. Aaron jumps down and sees Aldous floating in the hot tub.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Fuck you, man! Fuck you! Aaron jumps into the hot tub and flips Aldous over.

dialogues.speaker: AARON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Aldous? Aldy? Aldous? Mr. Snow? He pokes the body. No movement. He starts performing CPR Aldous, gingerly breathing into Aldous’s mouth and pumpin his chest. Soon his CPR gets more and more vigorous.

dialogues.speaker: AARON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (with each pump) Fuck! You! Fuck! You! You! Are! A! Dick! I! Hope! This! Doesn't! Work! Why! Do! I! Have! Mor! Als!  114. Aldous comes to and sucks in a breath. As Aldous and Aaro talk, the hot tub slowly turns red with Aldous’s blood.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: I’m alive. I’m alive! I can’t believe I’m alive! You saved me, Aaron. I can’t believe you came and saved me.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I only came because I didn’t want your death on conscience. I thought that maybe I’d go to jail if I didn’t show up.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: I have completely changed as a result of the love you've given me by saving me.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: As soon as you see a girl with big tits or a pound of hashish it’1l start all over again.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: (starting to cry) I look at you, Aaron, and I see pure love. You are the most beautiful person I have ever met.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I’m an enabler who is probably responsible for the fact that you have learned nothing and will be smoking crack within the next fifteen minutes.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: I am going to prove you wrong. That’s how I feel about you. Because we are going to be best friends forever.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I won’t because you fucked my girlfriend and screwed me out of my job.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: We can still make it.  115.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: It’s over, man. The show was supposed to start almost three hours ago.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: I’m always at least four hours late. My fans all know this. Once, in Manchester, I went on at 2:10AM. Performed for six hours. We can still make it. (as they start to get out of the tub) My arm hurts. Aaron looks at Aldous’s arm. The bone’s sticking through. Aaron THROWS UP on Aldous. INT. AARON’S CAR Aaron's frantically driving Aldous.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Are you sure we shouldn’t go to the emergency room?

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: It’s just pain. Pain is fleeting. Love is forever. You have given me love so in turn I shall give you sobriety. From now on nothing’s more important to me than my sobriety. Aldous opens up his manpurse and downs a bunch of pain pi

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: That’s the quickest trip to hypocrisy maybe in history.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: There is literally no way I can save your job right now without fourteen Vicodin. My bone is sticking out here. Touch it. That’s bone.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Please stop referencing your bone. Aldous touches his bone.  116.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: It’s so weird. You can’t feel your bone if you touch it. It’s like touching a drumstick or something. Aaron gags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron and Aldous pull up the driveway to the Greek past a giant sign that says “Aldous Snow -- LIVE FOR THE FIRST T IN THREE YEARS!” We hear booing from the auditorium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron and a limping Aldous head backstage. The crowd is booing and partying. Sergio heads towards them. *

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: He jumped off the Hollywood sign and broke his arm. Also I’m not gay. Fire me now. Just be done with it.

dialogues.speaker: SERGIO
dialogues.text: He can’t perform in that shape. Aldous is already on stage.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: Allo, Los Angeles! Are you ready to rock out? The crowd cheers.

dialogues.speaker: SERGIO
dialogues.text: I guess he can. Congrats, Greenberg. You are no longer an unpaid intern in the classical * music department. You’ve just been * promoted. You will now be an assistant in the A&R department.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I’m not an intern. I’m from * Columbia Vancouver -- *

dialogues.speaker: SERGIO
dialogues.text: No you're not. Take it or leave * it. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just made you guys potentially millions of dollars. I will not take it. Sergio stares him down.

dialogues.speaker: AARON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I will happily take it.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: This song is dedicated to my good buddy Aaron Greenberg -- get on out here. Aaron doesn’t want to.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get on out here, Aaron Greenberg! Get on out here, Aaron Greenberg! The crowd starts chanting this as well.

dialogues.speaker: GET ON OUT HERE, AARON GREENBERG
dialogues.text: Sergio nods to Aaron. Aaron walks out onto stage. cheers. Aaron smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: This man, while he didn’t save me from jumping off the Hollywood sign, at least showed up. Even after I made love to his girlfriend. Now that’s true friendship. The crowd doesn’t know how to respond to this.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I also wish to make an announcement. I’m quitting drugs and the alcohol. The audience starts booing. 117.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd *  118.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If anyone ever sees me drinking a beer or smoking a joint or doing any other kind of controlled substance you have my legal permission to beat the living shit out of me. The crowd cheers like crazy.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And a one! A two! A one two three! Aldous tries to strum the guitar and HOWLS IN PAIN.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That fucking hurts! Holy shit that hurts! Ahhh! Aldous unwraps his bandage to reveal his bone.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Check out my bone! Check it out! Ahhh! The pain!!!!! The band stops playing.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’re you doing!? Keep playing! They start playing again. Aldous begins singing and howli in pain all at once.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (singing) Love explosion! It's a love explosion! My love explodes into your heart! It explodes all over your chest! It’s awesome. The crowd goes crazy. Aldous begins jumping up and down and then PASSES OUT on the stage. In a moment odd enthusiasm, Aaron grabs the microphone and motions fo the band to start playing. Aaron continues the song.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: (singing) My love explodes all over the Earth! My loves explodes across the universe! The crowd BOOS.  119.

dialogues.speaker: AARON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well fuck you all too! Aaron starts proudly parading around the stage flipping t off as medics rush onstage to take care of Aldous. Aaron rushes over to Aldous. Aldous’s eyes flutter open.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: Get your lady back, man. You’re too much of a pussy to live in this world without her. EXT. DAPHNE’S PARENTS HOUSE - NIGHT Aaron pulls up to Daphne’s parents’ house. It’s a nice ho on the ocean in Laguna. He runs up to the door. Not wanti to wake anyone up, he knocks lightly on the door. Then he finally hits the doorbell. A very long door chime version “Lollipop” plays. Mr. Binks opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BINKS
dialogues.text: What the hell time is it?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Five a.m. Is Daphne here?

dialogues.speaker: MR. BINKS
dialogues.text: I don’t think she wants to see you.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Respectfully, sir, I don’t care what you think. Aaron PUSHES past Mr. Binks and into the house. INT. DAPHNE’S PARENTS HOUSE - CONTINUOUS Aaron heads into the Great Room.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Daphne! Daphne! Daphne and her mom come to the head of the stairs. Aaron Daphne have this entire conversation in front of her pare

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Aaron? What're you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I’m sorry I called you a whore.  120.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: I deserved it.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: No one deserves to be called a whore. Not even an actual whore. I want to get back together.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: I do too. Desperately.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: But only if you promise never to have sex with another man in front of me.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: I won't.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: And one other thing, I do understand what it takes to be a creative type. And when you say I don't it's condescending and bitchy and I don’t like it at all and rather than whining about whether your sculptures will or won't sell or whether people will or won't like them you should just get a fucking gallery and show them already. As the sun rises through the windows of their Great Room, Daphne tears down the stairs --

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: I love you when you're honest. -- and kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: While I was watching him there was nothing he was doing that I couldn’t physically do -- except for that one thing on the floor. I just wouldn’t have the courage to ask you.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: You don’t have to do every thing Aldous did. But maybe one of the twelve things.  121.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Great. So let’s go do this --

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: I can’t do it now. I have some kind of infection down there. I hate that fucking guy. It stings so bad.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry, baby. Aaron hugs Daphne.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BINKS
dialogues.text: (oddly touched) Awww.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: So when should we do this?

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: I can have sex again in three weeks.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Three weeks is a long time from now. It’ll give me time to prepare mentally. INT. AARON AND DAPHNE’S BEDROOM —- NIGHT CHYRON: EXACTLY THREE WEEKS LATER. A nervous looking Aaron looks at something.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: You sure you’re OK with this?

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: For the third time, yes! REVEAL Daphne is tied up.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: And you promise you won't be thinking of Aldous while we're doing it?

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: (probably lying) I promise. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (then) Now let’s get going already! Aaron PULLS OUT his Dustbuster. EXT. AARON AND DAPHNE’S APARTMENT We hear the drone of the vacuum cleaner and Daphne’s SHRI of delight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron, Aldous, and Naples are hiking. As they hike, Aldou sucking down a sucrose gel pack.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: I’m just incredibly grounded these days. Eight months clean.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: That’s really great. I’m impressed. And it’s so great to see that you’ve reconnected with your son.

dialogues.speaker: NAPLES
dialogues.text: I’m not his son.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS
dialogues.text: He’s just my mate. His dad’s actually Hugh Grant. Who knew? He’s staying with me for the month. His mother’s kind of a W-H-O-R-E. He sucks down another gel pack.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The point is I’m finally living the clean life we’re all meant to live and it’s all because of you. Thank you, Aaron, for pulling me back from the edge and showing me the way towards a healthy, safe existence. PULL BACK TO REVEAL they’re at the edge of a cliff.

dialogues.speaker: ALDOUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Meet you both at the bottom! Aldous straps on a backpack and BASE JUMPS OFF THE CLIFF. Aaron and Naples watch him drift down.  123.

dialogues.speaker: NAPLES
dialogues.text: At least he’s not on crack.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: This is better than crack?

dialogues.speaker: NAPLES
dialogues.text: Kind of. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: OVER CREDITS
dialogues.text: We see the youtube clip from the beginning. Aldous is punching himself in the face. It’s horrific. Then he reaches into his mouth and pulls out tooth after tooth, whipping each one at the audience.
